post.title: Why did you choose your username?

author.bio:
Ruqqus cofounder and lead backend developer.

https://github.com/captainmeta4
author.bio_html:
Ruqqus cofounder and lead backend developer.

https://github.com/captainmeta4

body:
My friend in middle school called my "captain metaphor" once. Shortly thereafter, I was making my first Runescape account and the name came to mind. There was a 12 character limit though, so "metaphor" got shortened to "meta4", and I've been using that as my name ever since.

The original metaphor from middle school involved Narnia. Sadly, I don't remember the details.
body_html:
My friend in middle school called my "captain metaphor" once. Shortly thereafter, I was making my first Runescape account and the name came to mind. There was a 12 character limit though, so "metaphor" got shortened to "meta4", and I've been using that as my name ever since.

The original metaphor from middle school involved Narnia. Sadly, I don't remember the details.

body:
I actually have a little bit of story. This username was the second username I made after getting banned from reddit for a too flawless #voterid meme. My first username was majorelle_blue after my favorite color (from when I first arrived to reddit), but upon making my second username (still for reddit) I wanted to make something more patriotic since by that time I only exclusively used The_Donald anyway.

My username is supposed to be a poetic reference to the part of our flag which has the stars on dark blue. Major/minor can refer to constellations as well. And I phrased it in a way that music is also written, like Waltz in C Major. (Blue is not a key, but that’s meant to be abstract.) And as might be obvious keeping blue and major in the name was meant to be a callback to my previous username to make me somewhat more recognizable to users who knew me under the previous username. I am not a Major, however I do now consider myself a digital soldier in the information war (in providing knowledge and truth, and clarifying lies and disinformation by the fake news etc) and I am flattered by people who have nicknamed me that. If you just call me blue, that’s cool too. 

And so there you have it:

Stars_in_blue_major

And pleased to make your acquaintance~

body:
My nickname means "lightbringer" in broken Latin. It *should* be "lucis", genitive, but... I use this nickname since dial up times. "V" for "U" to make more unlikely the nickname is already used, it isn't like Latin tells both apart.

Resemblances between "lucis ferre" and "Lucifer" are not a coincidence BTW.

body:
Because I hate picking a name and not being able to stick with one (I change names all the time) I just bashed my head on the keyboard and came out with this (well not exactly it since I had to tidy it up). But that's exactly how I got my name.

I swear it's not related to xQcOW, It's a pure coincidence that we have such similar names lol.

parent.body:
I actually have a little bit of story. This username was the second username I made after getting banned from reddit for a too flawless #voterid meme. My first username was majorelle_blue after my favorite color (from when I first arrived to reddit), but upon making my second username (still for reddit) I wanted to make something more patriotic since by that time I only exclusively used The_Donald anyway.

My username is supposed to be a poetic reference to the part of our flag which has the stars on dark blue. Major/minor can refer to constellations as well. And I phrased it in a way that music is also written, like Waltz in C Major. (Blue is not a key, but that’s meant to be abstract.) And as might be obvious keeping blue and major in the name was meant to be a callback to my previous username to make me somewhat more recognizable to users who knew me under the previous username. I am not a Major, however I do now consider myself a digital soldier in the information war (in providing knowledge and truth, and clarifying lies and disinformation by the fake news etc) and I am flattered by people who have nicknamed me that. If you just call me blue, that’s cool too. 

And so there you have it:

Stars_in_blue_major

And pleased to make your acquaintance~

body:
For the first part, my name is Jeff, clearly.

For the second part, I have a lot of relatives with pugs, and as a kid I liked them a lot, so I made it my username on a lot of sites (as typical 8 or 9 year old me would do). Then, I eventually learned about the existence of furries, a tumor on the Earth. So on a lot of my social media accounts I have to put "Not a Furry" as my description for clarification, so that I don't get mixed up with degenerates.

post.title: Why did you choose your username?

body:
Wanted to create a meaningful word that when googled would return pretty much only me.
First created it for my Xbox.

Nowadays not sure how I feel about having such an easy to trace name.
There are positives and negatives but there are always ways around the negatives.

Wanted to create a meaningful word that when googled would return pretty much only me. First created it for my Xbox.

Nowadays not sure how I feel about having such an easy to trace name. There are positives and negatives but there are always ways around the negatives.
